visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render an area chart with pattern fills. The chart should have a title 'Area Chart with Pattern Fills', with invisible axes. The chart should have two data series, each with a specific color and pattern fill. The first series should have data [29.9, 71.5, 106.4, 129.2, 144.0, 176.0, 135.6] and a pattern fill with a blue color. The second series should have data [null, null, null, null, null, 43.1, 95.6, 148.5, 216.4, 194.1, 95.6, 54.4] and a pattern fill with a red color. The chart should have a high-contrast light theme, and the legend should be disabled.

screenReaderSection.beforeChartFormat: Area chart showing use of visual pattern fills.

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render an area chart with pattern fills. The chart type is set to 'area', and it includes a title 'Area Chart with Pattern Fills'. The x-axis and y-axis are set to be invisible, and the exporting feature is disabled. The chart uses a high-contrast light theme, and accessibility settings are configured to provide a description for screen readers. The legend is disabled, and the chart includes two data series. The first series contains data points [29.9, 71.5, 106.4, 129.2, 144.0, 176.0, 135.6] with a blue color and a specific pattern fill. The second series contains data points [null, null, null, null, null, 43.1, 95.6, 148.5, 216.4, 194.1, 95.6, 54.4] with a red color and a different pattern fill. Each pattern fill is defined by a path, width, height, and opacity, creating a visually distinct area chart.
